src:
El tenso round televisivo entre Daniel Stingo y Marcela Sabat
Se dio durante el matinal "Muy Buenos Días" de TVN.
05 Nov 2019 by Claudio Caldera
Daniel Stingo y la diputada Marcela Sabat tuvieron un fuerte cruce esta mañana durante el matinal "Muy Buenos Días" de TVN, respecto a la crisis social que está viviendo el país durante las últimas semanas. 
Todo partió cuando el abogado indicó que "mi sensación es que usted quiere empatar, diputada. No quiere hacerse responsable", a lo que fue respondido con un "Daniel, eres tan subjetivo en tus apreciaciones".
"Hay un empate porque quieren poner en el mismo nivel a aquellos que entorpecieron y que son dueños del capital, que son los mismos políticos y empresarios, con la gran masa de Chile", siguió diciendo el letrado. 
Pero sabat contrarrestró diciendo que "creo que hay que dejar de hablar con tanta intransigencia, eso necesitamos en política: diálogo ciudadano, escuchar", añadió la diputada.
"Que quede claro que respeto mucho a su persona y su gestión, pero es su sector el que no quiere correr el cerco. El que se opuso toda la vida al cambio en Salud, Educación, no fue el partido comunista, fue RN y la UDI", cerró Stingo
text:
The tense television round between Daniel Stingo and Marcela Sabat
It was given during the morning "Very Good Morning" of TVN.
05 Nov 2019 by Claudio Caldera
Daniel Stingo and the deputy Marcela Sabat had a strong crossing this morning during the morning "Very Good Morning" of TVN, regarding the social crisis the country is experiencing during the last weeks.
It all started when the lawyer indicated that "my feeling is that you want to tie, deputy. You don't want to take responsibility," to which he was answered with a "Daniel, you are so subjective in your assessments."
"There is a tie because they want to put on the same level those who hindered and who own the capital, who are the same politicians and businessmen, with the great mass of Chile," continued the lawyer.
But sabat countered by saying that "I think we have to stop talking so intransigently, we need that in politics: citizen dialogue, listening," the deputy added.
"It is clear that I respect his person and his management very much, but it is his sector that does not want to run the fence. The one who opposed his whole life to the change in Health, Education, was not the communist party, it was RN and the UDI ", closed Stingo
